title: Edamame & Lentil Protein Salad
description: High-protein salad with lentils, edamame, and fresh vegetables, perfect for post-workout meals
ingredients: 1 cup green or French lentils (uncooked, ~½ lb)
2 cups kale (stems removed, chopped) or arugula
2 tbsp pumpkin seeds or sunflower seeds (toasted, optional)
2 tbsp red wine vinegar (or apple cider vinegar)
1 tsp honey or maple syrup (optional for balance)
instructions: Cook the lentils: Rinse well. Add to a pot with 3 cups water, bring to boil, then simmer ~20–25 min until tender but not mushy. Drain and cool.
Cook the edamame: Boil or microwave from frozen (about 3–5 min). Drain.
Prep the greens: If using kale, massage with a tiny drizzle of olive oil + pinch of salt for 1–2 minutes to soften. If using arugula, just toss it in raw.
Make dressing: Whisk olive oil, vinegar, mustard, honey, salt, and pepper until smooth.
Assemble: In a large bowl, combine lentils, edamame, kale/arugula, carrot, and celery. Toss with dressing. Sprinkle pumpkin seeds on top.
notes: Serves 2 big portions. Nutrition per large serving (~½ recipe): Calories: ~450, Protein: ~28–30g, Carbs: ~50g (high-fiber), Fat: ~15g (healthy fats), Fiber: ~15g.
